results.content: This is a great beginner course
I really enjoyed the course and got a lot out of it. Although it was a bit older with the version of Rails used and the Bootrap version, I was able to manage it and complete it with current versions.
results.content_html: I really enjoyed the course and got a lot out of it. Although it was a bit older with the version of Rails used and the Bootrap version, I was able to manage it and complete it with current versions.

results.content: If I could give John Elder 10 stars I would. He goes above and beyond the call of duty. His method is very faced paced which I really liked. He doesn't waste time and get's right to the point but at the same time he is very clear and his tone is smooth. By the end of the course you will have a cute little app in which you can build on. I feel like I got a lot out of this course . All valuable things such as  the cloud 9 ide , pushing to github and finally hosting on the cloud using Heroku. He also gave a great overview of ruby, rails and bootstrap.

results.content: This is the second course of John's that I have completed. And have enjoyed both of them very much!! My first ever Rails course was his Ruby on Rails for Web Development where he walks you through building a Pinterest clone app. I learned so much through that course even though I had just started learning Ruby and barely even knew what Ruby on Rails was. That app remains to be one of my favorite completed projects. I often refer back to the course when implementing the gems we used while creating that app in a new project. This course, Ruby on Rails: Superhero Generator, also proved to be a lot of fun to work on, while still learning new aspects of Ruby and Ruby on Rails. Definitely a good course choice on my journey to become a Rails developer. Thanks for another fun course John!
